desc: The FAM58A gene encodes a protein with a cyclin-box-fold domain, which resembles those found in cell cycle regulator proteins known as cyclins. However, only recently the product of FAM58A gene has been characterized as the cyclin M protein (PMID: 24218572). Cyclin M interacts with cyclin-dependent kinase 10 (CDK10) and induces degradation of transcription factor ETS2. Silencing or truncating mutations of FAM58A/cyclin M stabilizes ETS2 protein levels, increases c-RAF signaling and confers tamoxifen resistance in breast cancer cells (PMID: 24218572). Germline loss-of-function and deletions in FAM58A have been identified as the genetic cause of STAR syndrome, an X-linked hereditary condition characterized by toe syndactyly, telecanthus and anogenital and renal malformations (PMID: 18297069). Mutations of FAM58A are rare events in human cancers, but one-third of them are truncating alterations (cBioPortal, MSKCC, Nov 2016).

gene.name: family with sequence similarity 58 member A

articles.title: CDK10/cyclin M is a protein kinase that controls ETS2 degradation and is deficient in STAR syndrome.
articles.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America
articles.reference: Guen VJ et al. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America. 2013 Nov 26;110(48)19525-30.

articles.title: Mutations in the cyclin family member FAM58A cause an X-linked dominant disorder characterized by syndactyly, telecanthus and anogenital and renal malformations.
articles.reference: Unger S et al. Nature genetics. 2008 Mar;40(3)287-9.

desc: FAM58A, a cyclin-related gene, is altered in the germline of patients with STAR syndrome.

gene.name: family with sequence similarity 58 member A
